New Records: Netherlands climbed off the bottom of the Cricket World Cup table
Key Match Events: Paul van Meekeren’s fiery spell proves crucial for Dutch
Bangladesh collapsed to 70 for six inside 18 overs
Bas de Leede getting the key dismissal of Mehidy Hasan Miraz for 35
Pre-Game Insights: Captain Edwards won the toss and chose to bat
Post-Match Reflections: I was speaking to a couple of guys and we were saying that if we could get 220 plus, we would be in the game … it was nice that the bottom order guys got us to what we thought was a pretty competitive total,
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Netherlands lost both of their openers in the first 14 balls
The result leaves the reigning champions England 10th and last in the standings.
Others: The Dutch seamers varied their pace and extracted bounce from a slow wicket at Kolkata’s Eden Gardens
